frontmatter.title: Red Hat Advanced Cluster Management for Kubernetes

internal.content:
---
title: Red Hat Advanced Cluster Management for Kubernetes 

---

import Globals from 'gatsby-theme-carbon/src/templates/Globals';

<PageDescription>


</PageDescription>

## Overview 

Red Hat Advanced Cluster Management for Kubernetes controls clusters and applications from a single console, with built-in security policies. Extend the value of Red Hat OpenShift by deploying apps, managing multiple clusters, and enforcing policies across multiple clusters at scale. 

- End-to-end visibility and control for your Kubernetes clusters

## Register Openshift Cluster with Redhat Marketplace

To register a cluster, Red Hat Marketplace provides a command that installs the Red Hat Marketplace Operator and updates your global cluster pull secret.

Refer the step by step [instructions](https://marketplace.redhat.com/en-us/documentation/clusters#register-openshift-cluster-with-red-hat-marketplace). As a result, you registered your cluster as well as installed Redhat Marketplace Opertor.

![Redhat Marketplace Cluster](/images/rhmclusters.png)

## Red Hat Advanced Cluster Management for Kubernetes

The Red Hat Marketplace offers a wide variety of products across 12 categories. As an example, let’s say that you want to try out Redhat Advanced Cluster Management.

![OpenShift Operator Install ](/images/rhacmsearch.png)

Create a project and name it "rh-acm-demo" in your IBM Cloud ROKS cluster.

### Buy the software

Go to the Marketplace catalog and search for Red Hat Advanced Cluster Management for Kubernetes. Select the correct tile and click on Free trial to start your 30-day trial, as shown in figure below

![OpenShift Operator Install ](/images/rhacmbuy.png)

Go to Workspace > click the My Software, which is shown in figure below

![OpenShift Operator Install ](/images/mysoftware.png)

### Install the software

Go to Workspace > My Software and click the Install Operator icon, which is shown in figure below

![OpenShift Operator Install ](/images/InstallOperator.png)

### Install the Red Hat Advanced Cluster Management for your free trial

Select the IBM Cloud ROKS cluster from the list of target clusters, then pick the namespace scope where you want to install the Operator, as shown in figure below

![OpenShift Operator Install ](/images/selectns.png)

### Verify the operator installation
Click the My Software / Red Hat Advanced Cluster and select the Operators Tab

![OpenShift Operator Install ](/images/rhacmverify.png)

Log in to the cluster to verify that the Operator installed successfully, as shown in figure belowrhc

![OpenShift Operator Install ](/images/clusterverify.png)

### OperatorHub - OpenShift Console

You can install OpenShift Operators directly from the cluster. Red Hat Marketplace Operators become available in the OperatorHub after you install the Marketplace Operator. To install a product directly from IBM Cloud ROKS, log in to the cluster, go to Operators > OperatorHub, search, and install. Below figure shows the dialog to install  

![OpenShift Operator Install ](/images/rhacminstalled.png)
